meanings.definition: In a way that relates to the normal functions of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: She physiologically adapted to the new environment.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how the medication would work physiologically.
meanings.sent3: The plant physiologically decided to grow towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: His heart raced physiologically as he approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's body responded physiologically to the intense training.

meanings.definition: In a way that pertains to the processes and functions of the body.
meanings.sent1: Eating healthy foods can benefit you physiologically.
meanings.sent2: The therapist discussed how stress impacts us physiologically.
meanings.sent3: The robot malfunctioned and started moving physiologically.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was racing physiologically with ideas for the project.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements were coordinated physiologically with the music.

meanings.definition: In a way that is characteristic of the functioning of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The baby's body temperature was regulated physiologically.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied how exercise affects us physiologically.
meanings.sent3: The car engine seemed to be running physiologically.
meanings.sent4: His brain was working physiologically to solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The bird's wings moved physiologically to catch the wind.
